title: Boolean Unateness Testing with Õ(n
abstract: We give an adaptive algorithm that tests whether an unknown Boolean function f: {0,1}^n -≈ {0, 1} is unate (i.e. every variable of f is either non-decreasing or non-increasing) or ≥-far from unate with one-sided error and O(n^{3/4}/≥^2) many queries. This improves on the best adaptive O(n/≥)-query algorithm from Baleshzar, Chakrabarty, Pallavoor, Raskhodnikova and Seshadhri when 1/ε
